item.title: Analytics
item.description: For “A Journey of Music” there are a lot of ways to measure player behaviour, game hardness and game popularity. That’s, why we compiled a list of possible metrics we would like to use, to analyse our game.

item.title: Finished the test level
item.description: Here is the Link to our latest Youtube-Video: Youtube-Video

item.title: Fuck Monogame - Our Transition to Godot 4
item.description: We’ve made mistakes, we finally admit it! Whilst Monogame was our original choice, the hiccups and discontinued libraries made it nearly impossible to got something going.

item.title: Music choices for the POC
item.description: Exciting news! We’ve made a decision on the soundtrack for our Proof of Concept. In keeping with our plan to create three levels set in different musical eras, we’ve carefully selected the following songs:

item.title: Our Memes
item.description: Credit, where Credit is due: Thanks to imgflip.com for their meme creating tool.

item.title: Plans No. 1
item.description: As it is only the start of the semester, we have more time than in three months from now, so we can put a lot of time into this.

item.title: Plans No. 2
item.description: As we concluded last week’s plans in our weekly review, we already thought of plans for this the week from 06.

item.title: Pledge of Commitment
item.description: The term is almost over and we wanted to say thank you to our readers! It has been a fun project and we definitely learned a thing or two ;).

item.title: Review No. 1
item.description: As we described our goals for the last week last weekend, we wanted to review our ongoings and also updating you on our plans for next week!

item.title: Review No. 2
item.description: Greetings! It’s been a while since our last update, but we’ve been hard at work on our game development project. While we’re not quite ready to share a playable prototype just yet, we wanted to take this opportunity to share some of the challenges we’ve encountered and outline our remaining tasks.

item.title: What still has to be done
item.description: At last, we want to provide a list, with features, which we haven’t finished or even started yet, but would definitely add to the look an feel of our game.
